channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: What the stock market typically does after the U.S. election, according to history
item.description: Stocks typically rise after a presidential election, but investors need to be prepared for some short-term choppiness first, history shows.

item.title: China's Singles Day shopping festival is more than halfway over. Here's how consumers are spending
item.description: Early indicators on China's biggest shopping event of the year reveal a pickup in select categories, and even predictions for modest sales growth overall.

item.title: China reviews plan to increase local government debt
item.description: A closely watched meeting of China's parliament on Monday reviewed a proposal to raise the local government debt limit, according to state media.

item.title: Trump's tariffs could trigger 'dramatic' price spikes on clothes, furniture, warns retail group
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has campaigned against Donald Trump's tariff proposals, calling them a sales tax on American consumers.

item.title: Germany's government is on the brink of collapse — here’s what could happen now
item.description: Germany's ruling coalition has long been standing on shaky ground, but the situation has become critical in recent weeks, with a breakup more likely than ever.

item.title: Singapore Airlines will add first class, revamp cabins for longest flights
item.description: Singapore Airlines will add a first class to its ultra-long-range aircraft and increase the number of business class seats in race for high-spending travelers.

item.title: Is this the world's 'coolest hotel room' for baseball fans? Go inside to see the view
item.description: Travelers who stay at the hotel inside the Es Con Field Hokkaido stadium can watch baseball games from their rooms or while soaking in natural hot springs.

item.title: Foreign buyers eye Japan's empty houses with millions available for cheap — but experts warn of risks
item.description: While many places in the world face a housing shortage, Japan is facing the opposite problem: An oversupply of homes on the market.

item.title: Move over Black Friday: Consumer interest in 'Travel Tuesday' soars
item.description: Search interest for "Travel Tuesday" rose more than 500% over the last two years, according to a report published Thursday by McKinsey & Company.

item.title: The Dow needs Nvidia to give chipmakers representation in index after Intel's plunge
item.description: Intel has fallen so far so fast that the chipmaker's stock price is no longer having an impact on the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

item.title: Labor strikes shut down operations at Canada's container ports from East to West Coast, with U.S. trade left in limbo
item.description: Ports of Vancouver and Prince Rupert are at a standstill after ILWU union workers walked off the job, the latest in a string of Canadian labor strikes.

item.title: Top Wall Street execs are getting skeptical on the Fed's easing path
item.description: Speaking at the Saudi Arabia's showcase economic conference, the Future Investment Initiative, last week, they see more inflation on the horizon for the U.S.

item.title: Quantifying how much Nvidia will influence the Dow after it joins the storied average
item.description: Nvidia will join the price-weighted Dow on Friday.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and OpenAI invest in robot startup Physical Intelligence at $2.4 billion valuation
item.description: Amazon's Jeff Bezos and OpenAI invested in Physical Intelligence, a robot startup that raised $400 million at a $2.4 billion post-money valuation.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway's cash fortress tops $300 billion as Buffett sells more stock, freezes buybacks
item.description: The Omaha, Nebraska-based conglomerate saw its cash fortress swell to a record $325.2 billion by the end of September.

item.title: 'Too much doom and gloom': OPEC chief is bullish on oil demand despite extended production cuts
item.description: The forecasts come amid a slowing Chinese economy, which has significantly hit oil demand and abundant global supply.

item.title: SK Hynix rallies 6.5% after Nvidia boss Jensen Huang asks firm to expedite next-generation chip
item.description: SK Group Chair Chey Tae-won said Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang asked him if SK Hynix could move the supply of high-bandwith memory (HBM) chips forward by six months.

item.title: Talen, Constellation and Vistra tumble after government rejects Amazon nuclear data center agreement
item.description: Talen Energy in March sold the data center campus to Amazon for $650 million, which would be powered by the nuclear plant in a first-of-its-kind deal.

item.title: Next U.S. president shouldn't surrender America's energy dominance, TotalEnergies CEO warns
item.description: TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne said he would be surprised to see the next U.S. president lose the country's competitive advantage in energy.

item.title: The year's top tech stock is up 300% thanks to AI — but it's not Nvidia
item.description: With its stock having quadrupled this year, AppLovin has outperformed all other U.S. tech companies valued at $5 billion or more.

item.title: European leaders breathe a sigh of relief as pro-EU candidate wins Moldova election
item.description: European leaders congratulated pro-Western incumbent Maia Sandu on winning a run-off vote in Moldova's presidential election at the week

item.title: China gears up for a big week as markets await U.S. elections and stimulus details
item.description: The size of China's highly anticipated stimulus plans will likely depend on the outcome of the U.S. presidential election, analysts say.

item.title: From nuclear to quantum computing, how Big Tech intends to power AI's insatiable thirst for energy
item.description: A huge upswing in the number of data centers shows no signs of slowing down, prompting Big Tech to consider how best to power the AI revolution.

item.title: Buy now, pay later giant Affirm expands to the UK in first major international foray
item.description: Affirm, the U.S. buy now, pay later firm, on Monday launched its services in the U.K. — its first expansion overseas.

item.title: How F1 can help engineer the world's net-zero future
item.description: Formula One has always tried to be more than just a good sport.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Eve of Election Day
item.description: Election day looms for U.S. voters, and the world watches.

item.title: Trump's closing campaign message is hampered by distractions, disconnect
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign has faced backlash for several controversial remarks in the final days of his campaign against Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: UK businesses warn Labour government's tax-raising budget will hurt hiring and boost inflation
item.description: British businesses took a bruising from Finance Minister Rachel Reeves' bumper tax rising budget on Wednesday.

item.title: The next U.S. president could inherit a booming economy. That's a daunting challenge.
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump both made the economy a focus of their campaign platforms since voters rank it a top priority.

item.title: UK's Conservatives name Kemi Badenoch as new leader, shifting the party further to the right
item.description: The U.K.'s opposition Conservative Party on Saturday named its new leader, following a long-drawn-out runoff after the Tories' landslide electoral defeat marked a moment of reckoning.
